page.title: 04PETTY CRIME IN GARFORTH
page.content: Garforth at the moment is suffering from a minor epidemic of{petty crime {particularly{vandalism}causing pointless damage to property.{Graffiti which is something that is written, painted or sprayed where it should not be, is commonplace on quite a few walls and ranges from pictures to bad language. One of the worst recent acts of vandalism was the smashing of a large engraved window}in{Garforth {Catholic Church.}This was done by a brick and people say it will cost Â£4000 pounds to repair. Lately there has been a spate of childrens' bikes being stolen, particularly those of the BMX kind. There have been several people{trespassing}in school grounds. Some throw mud at windows or smoke and drink cider.{West Garforth Junior {School}was burnt down in 1984 a result of trespassers playing with matches.
